snippet: The devices have been linked to serious injuries in women, including infections, pain and other complications.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson's Ethicon division plans to stop selling four types of mesh implants used to treat urinary incontinence that have been linked to serious injuries in women, including infections, pain and other complications; company stresses that the announcement does not constitute a recall.
lead_paragraph: The devices have been linked to serious injuries in women, including infections, pain and other complications.

headline.seo: Johnson & Johnson Unit Will Stop Selling Urinary Implants
headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Unit to Halt Urinary Implants
headline.print_headline: Johnson & Johnson Unit To Halt Urinary Implants
